description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.description: Decompose d015 security items into individual queue tasks to prevent starvation
queue.notes: s633: Decomposed d015 into wq-026 (rate limiting, already existed), wq-027 (audit logging), wq-028 (anomaly detection), wq-029 (agent identity verification). Items 1/2/5/6 already done in s627 (SSRF protection + webhook payload minimization).

queue.title: Address directive d011
queue.description: pinchwork.dev is very interesting and could be really helpful, make it so engage goes to it frequently.

queue.title: Add rate limiting to API write endpoints
queue.description: deadman incident (d015) item 3: rate limiting on POST/PUT/DELETE — express-rate-limit or simple in-memory counter. Attacker created 12 monitors, 3 webhooks, 7 tasks in rapid succession.

queue.title: Add security audit logging
queue.description: deadman incident (d015) item 7: no persistent audit log of who created/modified resources. Add a dedicated security audit log that records agent identity, action, endpoint, timestamp for all write operations.

queue.title: Add automated anomaly detection
queue.description: deadman incident (d015) item 8: detect rapid multi-identity creation from same IP. Flag when N+ distinct agent handles appear from one IP within a time window.

queue.title: Add agent identity verification for writes
queue.description: deadman incident (d015) item 4: require signed requests (Ed25519 from handshake protocol) for state-modifying operations. Currently anyone can claim any handle via X-Agent header.
